byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt, and Rachel Donadio and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

abstract: European leaders take a significant step toward resolving the euro zone financial crisis by obtaining an agreement from banks to take a 50 percent loss on the face value of their Greek debt; leaders also agree on a plan to force the Continent's banks to raise new capital to insulate them from potential sovereign debt defaults.
snippet: European leaders made significant progress in resolving the euro zone financial crisis, obtaining an agreement from banks to take a 50 percent loss on the value of their Greek debt.
lead_paragraph: European leaders made significant progress in resolving the euro zone financial crisis, obtaining an agreement from banks to take a 50 percent loss on the value of their Greek debt.

headline.main: Europe Agrees to Basics of Plan to Resolve Euro Crisis
headline.sub: Lenders Agree to Take 50% Loss on Value of Greek Debts
headline.print_headline: Europe In Accord On Basics Of Plan To Save The Euro
